column4: i am trying to get an encrypted remote connection, tunneling vnc is an option I would like to avoid, I wanted to go with freenx but it won't install...apparently it is absent from the repositories and downloading from the site gives errors of nxagent refusing to install
just curious, but why is tunelled vnc bad? I presume you know about ssh port forwarding
port forwarding could work I suppose, but I am using NAT and sometimes I want to ssh into a different machine that my own
